title: Ocean Week Progress
body:
10 hours in and not looking promising.

Of a total 95,000 points for today, have yet to break the 10,000 point barrier (averaging ~9,500 points per hour, currently).

Maybe Riot overestimated the participation?

replies.body: Australians and New Zealand people have been asleep... so I'd say that's pretty good.

Sorry for not replying to this one earlier! 

We actually had a bug with a large amount of the points that were earned in the first few hours of yesterday. This bug was fixed, and the missing points were given to the correct players later in the afternoon. This lead to what seemed like a slow start yesterday, and a bit of a jump in the afternoon!

No we just have had the most minor 10 hours so far.

It's barely moved for like 6 hours, the majority of play occurs between 5pm-2am.

I'm not saying the rate isn't going to improve, however, based on how things are going so far, it doesn't seem like it will improve enough to reach the target.

I'm quite confident it will hit 50,000 at least, once more people start playing later in the day, but even so, 95,000 seems like an overestimate of the participation *at this point*.

Hint: You may not have noticed, but 95,000 is actually just 19,000 games of league at 1 point, assuming everyone is signed up.

But because SR is the bonus right now, it only requires 9,500 games.

I think this is very much manageable, if anything the challenge will be getting the points when the bonus is off of SR.

EDIT: hell, the increase is already showing, 16k down before midday.
